io.github.samwright.framework.model.common

Interface EventuallyImmutable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Element, Processor, TopProcessor, Workflow, WorkflowContainer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractElement, AbstractProcessor, AbstractWorkflow, AbstractWorkflowContainer, Adder, ChooserWorkflowContainer, ContourFinder, ExContainer, FingertipFinder, FingertipReducer, HandDetector, ImageLoader, KeyboardActor, MockElement, NNClassifier, Optimiser, PalmDetector, SimplifyContour, SkinDetector, SplitJoinWorkflowContainer, StartElement, StaticColourRange, TopWorkflowContainer, Viewer, WorkflowImpl

    public interface EventuallyImmutable
    An object which eventually becomes immutable.

    It might be immutable from creation, or it might start as mutable and become immutable. Once immutable, it can not become mutable.

    The convention to use is X getX() for accessors and EventuallyImmutable withX(newX) for mutators.

    Whilst this.isMutable(), mutators mutate the internal data and return the same object. Once immutable, mutators create a mutable clone and mutations are applied to it, i.e. createMutableClone().withX(newX).

    Mutations can therefore be strung together, e.g. obj.withX(newX).withY(newY).withZ(newZ) will return obj with the mutations if obj.isMutable() or obj.createMutableClone() with the mutations otherwise.

    See Also:
    MutabilityHelper

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      EventuallyImmutable createMutableClone()
      Create a mutable clone of this object.
      boolean isMutable()
      Returns true iff this object is mutable, meaning it was created as mutable and has not been finalised.

    • Method Detail

      • createMutableClone

        EventuallyImmutable createMutableClone()
        Create a mutable clone of this object. It will remain mutable until passed as a replacement to replaceWith(replacement), at which point fixAsVersion(..) will be called to effect the change to an immutable object.
        Returns:
        a mutable clone.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if this object is still mutable.

      • isMutable

        boolean isMutable()
        Returns true iff this object is mutable, meaning it was created as mutable and has not been finalised.
        Returns:
        true iff this object is mutable.
